intro: Draba karr-aikensis var. major, commonly known as the Karr-aikensis Draba, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
